chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
  <s>THE SYNOD OF AURELIUS, BISHOP OF CARTHAGE.</s>
<break time="1s"/>
</speak>

From the synodical letter, found in Labb. Councils, volume two, column 1184.

After Theodosius and Nectarius ascended to the heavens, Arcadius, son of Theodosius, took the throne, while Honorius, Arcadius's brother, succeeded Gratian.

During this period, a provincial and sacred synod convened in Carthage, attended by one hundred twenty-seven fathers.

This synod took decisive action against the idol-worshipping Donatists, other heresies, and errors in the region. It was led by Aurelius, the bishop of Carthage.

The sacred and divine canons it issued remained effective until the time of the younger Theodosius.
chunks.original_latin:
Ex libello synodico, apud Labb. Concil. tom. II, col. 1184. (S)   
 Θεοδοσιου γουν και Νεκταριου μεθαρμοσθεντων προς τα ουρανια, του μεν την βασιλειαν ο υιος Αρκαδιος διαδεχεται, Γρατιανου δε, ο αδελφος Αρκαδιου Ονοριος. Εν οις χρονοις εν Καρθαγενη συνοδος τοπικη και ιερα συναθροιζεται, πατερων εκατον εικοσι και επτα συνελευσιν φερουσα· κατα ειδολων  Δονατιστων, και αλλης εκαστης αιρεσεως, και των εν τοποις εκεινοις ατοποις σφαλματων, τας πραξεις ποιησασα. Ης ηγειτο Αυρηλιος ο Καρθαγενης επισκοπος. Και κανονας ιερους εκθεμενη και θειους, εως καιρων του μικρου Θεοδοσιου διηρκεσε. Theodosio igitur et Nectario ad coelestia translatis,
in illius quidem imperium filius Arcadius successit,
ut in Gratiani Honorius, Arcadii frater. Quo
tempore Carthagine Synodus provincialis et sacra
congregata fuit, patrum centum viginti et septem
conventum prae se ferens, quae contra idololatras
Donatistas, et aliam quamcumque haeresin, et alia
illorum locorum errata, actiones instituit: cui praefuit
Aurelius Carthaginensis episcopus. Canones sacri
et divini, quos illa edidit, ad Theodosii usque
minoris tempora obtinuerunt.
